nodes.text:
Captain Johnson, I have a number of questions before we deploy and I doubt Captain Murray is in a mood to be interrogated by me.

The most pressing is: what have you learned about their identity?

Lord Madeira, have you ever heard of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreGalicianUnion],Galician Union]] during your time with [[DM.Factions[faction_InterstellarExpeditions],Interstellar Expeditions]]?

Perhaps it is better if I start this story from there.
I can't say I have, a planetary state somewhere in the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDeepPeriphery],Deep Periphery]] I assume?

Yes, the Union was a consisting of a pair of two systems several hundreds of light years spinwards of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreZwerdacEmpire],Zwerdac Empire]], somewhere past the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreTheSwansEye],Swan's Eye]] and even the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreOrionRift],Orion Rift]].

I know those two astronomical features from [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreComStarExplorerCorps],Explorer Corps]] and [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreStarLeague],Star League]] star charts from being in the border of the Hyades Rim with the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSpinwardPeriphery],Spinward Periphery]], but I don't recall any mentions to the Zwerdua... the Empire you just mentioned, Captain Johnson.

The Zwerdac 'Empire' really was a nothing more than a collective of marauder gangs preying on the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDarkExpanse],Dark Expanse]].

They had managed to group together and pool resources for perform raids in the Spinward Periphery.

Back then I was stationed in the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreOutworldsAlliance],Outworlds Alliance]], and occasionally one of the Zwerdac Empire's pirate bands would descend on the world and do some stealing but the local planetary Council had made a deal with their leadership to leave them alone.

Until one day, one of their leaders called Kerrigan landed on the planet and told us that they had been nearly wiped out by another group using unidentified 'Mechs and 'magic'.

Kerrigan and his band had just returned from raiding a [[DM.Factions[faction_Davion],Davion]] world but had parked their DropShip outside the main settlement to avoid disputes over the loot.

That saved their lives when the raiders suddenly arrived and destroyed the rest of the Zwerdac Empire's forces in a matter of minutes.

Interesting story and analogy but it may not have been the same raiders we are facing here, Captain Johnson.

Or are we jumping ahead at conclusions?

Lord Madeira, I had never believed Kerrigan's story for years even after I personally interrogated him before [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreBaliggora],Baliggora]]'s security forces took him away.

Yet, once Captain Murray came to me and showed me the holovids of those raiders, I immediately felt something similar with Kerrigan's description.

Well Captain Johnson, the {COMPANY.CompanyName} have faced their unknown 'Mechs several times but with no idea behind their identities.

And they all rigged with self-destruction devices on their cockpits that have made it impossible for me to capture any pilot so any identification is impossible.

Ahead of you Mr. Oliveira, we have already captured and interrogated a few Harbingers while scouting Fairuza, they are all from [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDeepPeriphery],Deep Periphery]] worlds but none seems to possess the technology levels to support Star League technologies as we have seen.

And they all reported that there are other groups involved but the pilots were ignorant of the full extent.

Both these groups are clearly organized as raiding parties, and they are used as raiders and later as occupying forces.

Or at least that's what the prisoners claimed before Captain Murray did a '[[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LorePurgeProtocol],purge protocol]]' on them.

And who is organizing all of this effort then, Captain Johnson?

I'm not convinced that there's a great horde made of roaming [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LorePeriphery],Periphery]] raiders in a mass migration.

You all know Captain Murray's story about how they razed the [[DM.Factions[faction_TortugaDominion],Tortuga Dominion]].

That's the best explanation I've heard so far to explain it, combined with what I already knew from Kerrigan and others.

Yes, but it clearly she is exaggerating the story or hiding something else because I can't confirm most of what she claims happened back there.

It's not easy to get intel or news from a pirate heaven.

Well, I can personally confirm the part about raiders with SLDF 'Mechs torching worlds... we even had a name for them back in my homeworld to scare off the kids. 'The [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreStarLeagueFirstLord],First Lord]] is coming to get you!'

It's normal for Periphery worlds to retain such memories after the destruction of the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreReunificationWar],Reunification War]] and the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAmarisCivilWar],Amaris Civil War]], Captain Johnson.

For many the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSLDF],SLDF]] and the Star League committed genocide against the Periphery.

And I can personally confirm the part about raiders razing worlds because I've seen them, Dr. Murad.

I have seen [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreKerenskysGhost],Kerensky's Ghosts]] razing my homeworld and I was one of the few that remained alive.

Yes Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}, during all these years I questioned if my memories were real until I arrived at this system and suddenly recognized everything.

But I had been told before that these kind of pirate mass hordes were thought to become extinct centuries ago.

Captain Johnson, our best guess is that they found a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreLosTech],LosTech]] cache somewhere in the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreDeepPeriphery],Deep Periphery]].

And the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreSuccessorState],Successor States]] is still a possible explanation even though they're all more busy fighting their wars again.

Dr. Murad, whatever the origin of this, Lady Arano is going to need a lot more than she has to defeat them.

Now it is our objective to give her as much time as possible to prepare.

Yeah it's time to discuss the next part of our combined operation before Murray wakes up and starts pushing us around again.

She already discussed with Captain Johnson their roles.
Wait, Darius how would you know...

branches.responseText: Moving along, what is our next target Captain Johnson?

nodes.text:
We have two main targets left in this planet, the [[DM.Factions[faction_TortugaPirates],Kittens]] are taking one and my [[DM.Factions[faction_GhostRiders],Ghost Riders]] are a part of the second. 

Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}, you need to decide which one you want to join.

branches.responseText: Naturally the Ghost Riders but you don't seem convinced.

nodes.text:
Murray has come up with a scheme to try to lure the Harbinger commanders to come after her.

It may work but the odds are better with {COMPANY.CompanyName} backing her.
I vote for the non-Kitten option, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}.
This is not a democracy Dr. Murad.
Well, it sure doesn't look like a proper military operation either XO, since all decisions seemed to be made by committee.

Yeah, a committee only made of one person and that in-between missions is drunk and hardly leaves her quarters.

Commander, why are we still here? We have the intel Lady Arano needs so let's leave this forsaken planet.

branches.responseText: Everyone stop right now, Lord Madeira is calling the shots here.

nodes.text:
We need more intel on these [[DM.Factions[faction_HarbingersOfDoom],Harbingers]] because I also don't fully trust 'the committee of one'.

So we stay for now but all tactical decisions are made by you Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}.

branches.responseText: Captain Johnson, what are the targets again?

nodes.text: The Kittens will be capturing a supply depot close to one of their command posts to raid it. I'll be dropping to mark a command post for the Pegasus to hit with her PPCs.

The Devil's Disciples nearly got wiped out by the Harbingers, so they are retreating while being pursed.

So it's they won't be able to assist on either the supply depot or the command post, Commander.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Story Decision: Help the Satan's Kittens.]</color> We'll deploy with Captain Murray.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Story Decision: Join the Ghost Riders.]</color> I still prefer to join forces with Captain Johnson.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Story Decision: Escort the escaping Disciples.]</color> The Devil's Disciples sound like they could use a hand.

nodes.text: Understood, I'll notify Captain Murray that we'll be joining her in the field.
If I know Murray, I would say that you better hurry because she's getting all ready to deploy, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}, with or without you.

And I am honored to deploy again with you, {COMMANDER.Callsign}.

With your assistance, this mission shouldn't fail.

Yes, although Murray says that they are perfectly capable of defending themselves.

But if you prefer to rescue the pirates, it's your call {COMMANDER.Callsign}.
And here we go again rescuing pirates.
